result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark C Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Allowed only if the Def is serving the 1st 15 days in Pepin or Buffalo County. Huber will not be allowed if serving time in Pierce County.

No contact of any kind what so ever with Andrea Belgen.
No Facebook postings that refer in anyway to Andrea Belgen.

Provide DNA sample.
Comply with conditions imposed by Agent.

timeConds.notes:
30 days of jail is stayed for the Agent to use at their discretion for violations. The remaing 30 days: First 15 days will be in custody and the second 15 days will be on home monitoring. Home monitoring to begin on April 8, 2017. Def may serve his time in Pepin or Buffalo County if there is no cost to Pierce County. Defendant must make those arrangement. Release date will be June 6, 2017.
The Def may serve in jail time in Pepin or Buffalo county for a total of 30 days with huber priviledges, in lieu of the 15 days and home monitoring.

****Furlough is granted from April 22, 2017 until May 3, 2017 at 10:00, so Def can be set up with the Pierce County work release home monitoring.***

of Attorney Fees

Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

4:07 p.m.  Defendant Mark C Anderson in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 16CM117.  O'Sullivan - guilty to Ct 1 in 16CF97 and Ct 1 in 16CM117, Deferred JOC on 16CF97, one year probation on 16CM117.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct. 1 in 16CF97 and Ct. 1 in 16CM117.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty  and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 16CM117.   Court finds defendant guilty and withholds judgment of conviction of Ct. 1 in 16CF97.  AB gives victim impact statement.  Helgeson addresses the court regarding sentencing.  16CM117 - .  Off the record at 4:52. p.m. 5:07 court resumes. Atty Helgeson states his Def wishes to proceed with sentencing; if any jail time if he requests the jail be served in another county if there is no cost to Pierce County. Def does not agree with statements made.  Court approves the DJOC and signs it for 16CF97. Court: S/W 1 year probation conditons: court costs and DNA sample. No contact  of any kind whatsoever with Andrea Belgen, no facebook posting that refer to her, 60 day jails with 30 days stayed for the Agent to use at their discretion for any violations. 1st 15 days in if in Pierce County without huber, if it's in Pepin or Buffalo may serve with huber, remaining 15 days can be served on home monitoring. Def must make arrangements to serve in another county with no cost to Pierce County. 30 days stayed until March 24, 2017 at 5pm release date will April 23, 2017. Monitoring will start April 8th regardless of where he is serving his time.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on January 30, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Judge Boles granted DA's Motion for continuance.  Atty Helgeson has no objection.
for Continuance filed by Atty Froelich

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

10:22 Defendant Mark C Anderson in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Court gives constitutional rights to the court room as a group. Each Defendant in a group exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the Def. OSullivan: $1000 sign bond with no contact provisions. Def has not objection.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
